Inserts in the form of a roll
Jaw carriers, i.e. components retaining the collet itself
Keys, spanners or wrenches to operate the collet chuck
Collets in which the jaws are formed as separate elements, i.e. not joined together
extending from both axial ends of the collet
having a special form not otherwise provided for
Compensating chucks, i.e. with means for the compensation of irregularities of form or position

Chucks with means to loosely retain the tool or workpiece in the unclamped position
Means to allow the facing of the axial end of the workpiece near the axis of rotation

Centres or drivers with a special arrangement of bearings or with special bearings

Centres or drivers supporting the workpiece at three points around the circumference

Shrink-fitted connections, i.e. using heating and cooling to produce interference fits
Connections using a tongue and a hollow of corresponding prismatic form

Improving heat transfer away from the working area of the tool by conduction

Cutting edges with a wave form
Cross sectional views of the cutting edges

increasing in a direction towards the shank from the tool tip
decreasing in a direction towards the shank from the tool tip

Drills in which the outer surface is of special form
Unequal spacing of cutting edges in the circumferential direction
Cutting teeth arranged at different heights
with increasing depth in a direction towards the shank from the tool tip
with decreasing depth in a direction towards the shank from the tool tip
of special form not otherwise provided for

Drills for cutting plugs of material
Margins, i.e. the area of the circumference following the axial cutting edge in the direction of rotation
Drills having a centre free from cutting edges or with recessed cutting edges
Drilling tools having provision for drilling different diameters
Detachable pilots, e.g. in the form of a drill
Drilling tools having means to reinforce the shank, e.g. drills having small shanks being gripped by devices having a larger shank
Drills operating in the reverse direction, i.e. in the unscrewing direction of a right-hand thread
Drills with provision to be used as a screwdriver
